page.title: 08Employment in Stratton
page.content: Of the 250 adults who live in Stratton, Ash Hill, Grimstone and Wrackleford, thirty are retired, and ten of these live alone. Farming supports five farmworkers, a manager, gamekeeper and the two estate owners and their respective families. Herrison Hospital employs thirteen, including administrators, nurses and occupational therapists. Six work far afield, twelve in Dorchester, ranging from shop assistants to two librarians and a policeman. There is small settled core of families,but the majority of households change every four or five years. There are only three self-employed: a book binder running his own firm, a motorbike specialist and an antique car restorer, but only the latter works in the village. There is no craft or employment apart from farmwork, here.
